models.event: The active event being played, containing format settings, scoring rules, and overall status. Now includes formatCategory field matching Events section's 6 categories.
models.courts: Physical playing surfaces at the venue, each with a real-time status showing whether a game is in progress, players are being called, or the court is available.
models.matches: Individual games between teams within the event. Tracks court assignment, players, scores, timing, and whether the match needs score confirmation.
models.players: Participants checked into the event, with their skill ratings, check-in status, and current match assignment.
models.matchQueue: Upcoming matches waiting to be assigned to courts, shown in order they'll be called.
models.standings: Running leaderboard showing player rankings based on wins, losses, and point differential.
models.scoreDisputes: Matches where players submitted conflicting scores, requiring Game Manager resolution.
models.tournament: Tournament-specific configuration including bracket type, seeding method, match format by round, consolation options, and multi-day settings.
models.seeds: Seeded entries in the tournament. Each seed represents a player or team with their seed number, rating, and bye status.
models.bracket: The bracket structure containing all matches organized by rounds. Supports single elimination, double elimination (with losers bracket), and consolation brackets.
models.bracketMatches: Matches within a bracket with position info, round designation, winner/loser advancement paths, and scheduled times.
models.pools: Pool play groups where players compete in round robin before advancing to bracket playoffs.
models.ladder: Ladder tournament standings with challenge configuration, position tracking, and activity monitoring.
models.ladderChallenges: Active or pending challenges between ladder positions, with deadlines and match scheduling.
models.roundRobinConfig: Round Robin event configuration including partner format (fixed, rotating, blind draw), pool structure, time format (games or timed), and standings calculation method.
models.roundRobinSchedule: The complete round robin schedule generated using Berger/Circle method, showing all rounds with match assignments, partners, courts, and timing.
models.roundRobinStandings: Standings table with USA Pickleball official tiebreaker hierarchy: head-to-head, overall point differential, H2H point differential, vs next-highest, coin flip.
models.roundRobinPools: Pools for larger round robin events, each containing teams, internal standings, round robin matches, and advancement status.
models.partnerRotation: Preview of partner assignments across all rounds for rotating partner formats, showing who plays with whom in each round.
models.roundRobinMatches: Matches in the round robin with partner info (for rotating formats), opponent info, court assignment, round number, and scores.
models.openPlaySession: Open Play/Drop-In session state with paddle queue, court status, and rotation management. Players join queue and get called to courts.
models.openPlayEvent: Open Play event configuration with rotation rules (paddle stack, winners stay, time-based) and skill balancing options.
models.clinicSession: Clinic/Class session with drill sequences, attendance tracking, and instructor notes. Progresses through defined drills on assigned courts.
models.clinicEvent: Clinic event configuration with instructor info, focus areas, skill level, and participant capacity.
models.teamMatch: MiLP-style team match containing multiple games (Men's Doubles, Women's Doubles, Mixed Doubles 1 & 2, optional Dreambreaker).
models.teamCompetitionConfig: Team competition configuration with game sequence, tiebreaker format, and team composition requirements.
models.teamStandings: Team standings showing match wins/losses, games won/lost, and point differential across the competition.
models.kingOfCourtSession: King of the Court session with ranked courts (Court 1 = King), current games, standings by wins and king court time.
models.abcdSession: ABCD Play session with four skill groups running parallel round robins, each tracking group standings and progress.

relationships: Each Event has many Courts available for play
Each Court can have one active Match at a time
Each Match has 4 Players (2 per team for doubles)
Players appear in the Standings based on their Match results
The MatchQueue feeds into Courts as they become available
Tournament belongs to Event (extends event with tournament-specific config)
Bracket belongs to Tournament and contains BracketMatches
BracketMatch links to Match for actual game data and tracks bracket position
Seeds determine initial bracket positions before tournament starts
Pools contain Matches for round robin play and advance top players to Bracket
Ladder contains LadderChallenges which create Matches when accepted
RoundRobinConfig belongs to Event and defines partner format, pool structure, and standings rules
RoundRobinSchedule contains all RoundRobinMatches organized by round
RoundRobinPools each contain a subset of teams and their internal round robin
RoundRobinStandings tracks player/team performance with tiebreaker details
PartnerRotation previews partner assignments for rotating partner format
OpenPlaySession belongs to Event and manages the paddle queue and court rotation
QueuePlayers wait in OpenPlaySession queue until called to an available court
ClinicSession belongs to Event and tracks drill progression and attendance
ClinicDrills are completed in sequence during a ClinicSession
TeamMatch contains multiple TeamGames (MD, WD, MX1, MX2, and optional Dreambreaker)
TeamStandings aggregate results across all TeamMatches in the competition
KingOfCourtSession ranks players by wins and time spent on King Court
KingCourts have a rank (1-4) and players move between them based on game results
ABCDSession runs parallel round robins in four skill groups (A, B, C, D)

tiebreaker.reason: Tied with Wilson/Brown at 2-2. Broke tie via: Head-to-head (W)
Tied with Johnson/Garcia at 2-2. Lost tie via: Head-to-head (L)
Tied with Anderson/Taylor at 0-3. Broke tie via: Overall point differential (+3 better)
Tied with Lee/Martinez at 1-2. Broke tie via: Overall point differential (+2 better)
Tied with Green/Adams at 1-2. Lost tie via: Overall point differential (-1 worse)
Tied with Baker/Nelson at 1-2, same PD. Broke tie via: Head-to-head (W over Baker/Nelson... wait, L). Actually lost H2H. Using H2H PD: -1 vs Baker/Nelson

advancementScenarios: Win Round 4: Clinch #2 seed regardless of Round 5 result
Lose Round 4, Win Round 5: Clinch #2 seed
Lose both: Fall to #3 if Johnson/Garcia wins out

roundRobinNotifications.message: Your match is starting on Court 2!
You're currently in position to advance to playoffs!
Pool A is 73% complete. Estimated finish: 11:30 AM
Tiebreaker applied in Pool A: Johnson/Garcia ranked above Wilson/Brown via head-to-head

tiebreaker.reason: Tied with Park/Williams at 2-0. Lost tie via: Overall point differential (-1)

advancementScenarios: Win remaining 3 rounds: Finish top 2 and potentially #1 seed

drills.name: Warm-up Rally
drills.instructions: Partner up and rally cross-court, focusing on soft hands.

drills.name: Third Shot Drop Progression
drills.description: Practice third shot drops from baseline
drills.instructions: Start at the baseline. Feed ball to partner at NVZ. Practice soft drops that land in the kitchen.

drills.name: Dink Patterns
drills.instructions: Practice diagonal and straight-ahead dink patterns.

drills.name: Live Point Play
drills.instructions: Play points starting from third shot situation.

clinicEvent.name: Intermediate Skills Clinic: Third Shot Mastery

kingOfCourtEvent.name: Saturday King of the Court Challenge
